Static Information Record 统计资料记录

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均可表示"先生"之意。
means: Mr. ： 是Mister的缩写形式，一般加在男子的姓或名字或职位之前，是对成年男子的尊称。Mr.多用于英国，Mr(未加圆点)多用于美国。
sir ： 较正式的呼语，书面文字或口语均可使用，其后不必加姓。

sentence.Network_en: Sir Robert made his announcement after talks with the President.
sentence.Network_cn: 在与总统会谈之后，罗伯特爵士发表了声明。

sentence.Network_en: Sir Denis took one look and sent it back.
sentence.Network_cn: 丹尼斯爵士看了一眼就把它送了回去。

sentence.Network_en: Sir Geoffrey had no personal animosity towards the Prime Minister.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰弗里爵士对首相并无私人恩怨。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: reduced form of sire

entry.tran: (对不知其姓名的男士或上级的尊称)先生，长官
entry.def: People sometimes say sir as a very formal and polite way of addressing a man whose name they do not know or a man of superior rank. For example, a shop assistant might address a male customer as sir .

example.ex: Excuse me sir, but would you mind telling me what sort of car that is?...
example.tran: 先生，请您告诉我那是什么类型的车好吗？

entry.tran: (用于爵士或准男爵的姓名前)爵士
entry.def: Sir is the title used in front of the name of a knight or baronet.

example.ex: She introduced me to Sir Tobias and Lady Clarke.
example.tran: 她把我引见给了托拜厄斯爵士和克拉克夫人。

entry.tran: (正式信函或商务信函开头的称呼语)先生，阁下(写信给某组织时使用 Dear sirs)
entry.def: You use the expression Dear sir at the beginning of a formal letter or a business letter when you are writing to a man. You use Dear sirs when you are writing to an organization.

example.ex: Dear Sir, Your letter of the 9th October has been referred to us.
example.tran: 尊敬的先生，您 10 月 9 日的来信已转交我处。

means.word_mean: 1. term of address for a man

sentences.en: Sir, is it time to begin?
Dear Sir, I am very glad and honoured to write to you.
sentences.cn: 亲爱的先生, 我能给你写信真是感到十分荣幸。

sentences.en: Sir John Smith baronet abandoned his son to his fate.

jushi.english: He replied to his wife,“No, sir,”when she asked him if he could stay home with their children in the evening.
jushi.chinese: 当他的妻子问他晚上是否可以在家同孩子一起,他回答：“绝对不行”。

jushi.english: Dear Sir,I am very glad and honored to write to you.
